channel.title: Alex Wilson's writing
channel.description: Alex on engineering, products & everything in-between

item.title: Weeknotes: Flowering ‚Äî Week 13, 2025
item.description: Cherry blossom season is upon us, and it‚Äôs gorgeous. The parks are chokka. Unfortunately the same cannot be said of the weather: It has been cold, and dark, and damp, and miserable all week. Between the weather and‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Cherry blossom season is upon us, and it‚Äôs gorgeous. The parks are chokka. Unfortunately the same cannot be said of the weather: It has been cold, and dark, and damp, and miserable all week.
  • Between the weather and immediately jumping back into work, even though it was a few days, I was suffering a proper holiday hangover this week.
  • Many years ago I read ‚ÄúWorking Effectively with Legacy Code‚Äù, and it excited me to work with gnarly codebases. Well, let‚Äôs just say I burned a lot of that excitement this week.
  • After missing 3 lessons in a row, Japanese class was incredibly rough. We made it, in the end, but wow there were moments where I doubted myself. Who‚Äôd have guessed that learning a language is hard.
  • Very thought provoking catch-up on Wednesday evening. üòÖ
  • Had a university final during the week. It caught me by surprise, but luckily it was in an area I know well. Finished with hours to spare.
  • Omiyage of sweetheart cake (ËÄÅÂ©ÜÈ§Ö) was very well received. I had a spare which I stuck‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Sharp Sandspit ‚Äî Week 12, 2025
item.description: If last week marked my first serious travel since the big move, this week marked my proper first holiday - and with it, more travel. Thursday was a bank holiday and together with Friday made for an extended ‚Äúlong‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• If last week marked my first serious travel since the big move, this week marked my proper first holiday - and with it, more travel. Thursday was a bank holiday and together with Friday made for an extended ‚Äúlong weekend‚Äù.

  • This week in data:

    • Maximum height: 332.6m
    • Kowloon Dairy products consumed: 7

  • After work on Tuesday evening I went to the top of Landmark 81 - the tallest building in Vietnam, the 2nd tallest in SEA and the 17th tallest in the world. It is also, by at least 100 meters, the highest I have ever been. Reaching the top, they strapped me to a pole and let me walk right up to the edge, where I took a few precarious photos and a selfie, right before scurrying right back down to ground level. Gorgeous view though, well worth the nerves.

  • Wrestled with some NodeJS meta-programming which I really didn't enjoy. Sometimes I think we had it good with n-gage.

  • And on Wednesday, REDACTED. All I‚Äôm saying.

  • On Thursday I packed up, picked up some laundry, had some emergency banh mi, and swatted away the biggest cockroach you ever did see, before collapsing into an airplane seat. Onboard I watched The Apprentice (2024), which I really rate, it‚Äôs a very good movie. Solid 3/5.

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Thanh ‚Äî Week 11, 2025
item.description: This week was spent in Ho Chi Minh City üáªüá≥ for both a business trip, and my first trip outside of Tokyo since the big move. This week in data: üåû Average temperature: 31¬∞C üå´Ô∏è Average humidity 67.36% ü§¢ Cockroaches‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• This week was spent in Ho Chi Minh City üáªüá≥ for both a business trip, and my first trip outside of Tokyo since the big move.

  • This week in data:

    • üåû Average temperature: 31¬∞C
    • üå´Ô∏è Average humidity 67.36%
    • ü§¢ Cockroaches spotted: 34

  • Monday begins mega early in Narita and possibly the slowest airport check in I‚Äôve ever done. Nearly an hour. Thankfully the rest of the journey to the gate was speedy, but, reader, I‚Äôd be lying if I didn‚Äôt say that this felt mega dicey.

  • Immediately on landing I‚Äôm struck by the heat. It‚Äôs hot. It‚Äôs so hot that every minute feels like five. By the time we get to a taxi my brain has nearly adjusted.

  • Our first meal is Ph·ªü at a local place, and it ends up being one of the tastiest meals of the week as well as due to my choice of toppings probably the least healthy. We get oodles of free vegetables which - coming from Tokyo - is amazing.

  • Bikes. Bikes everywhere.

  • With many of us colocated in the same space for the first time in a while, we ran through lots of workshops ranging from talking about our backgrounds to experiencing what it‚Äôs like for users to use one of our products. Great energy all around and I enjoyed the time with people I don‚Äôt normally work with.

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Searching ‚Äî Week 10, 2025
item.description: Hello from Narita. I took three trains and a bus to get here ‚Äî normally it‚Äôs only one train ‚Äî so, not in a great mood. Hopefully tomorrow‚Äôs breakfast will make the journey worth it! With next week being my first real‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Hello from Narita. I took three trains and a bus to get here ‚Äî normally it‚Äôs only one train ‚Äî so, not in a great mood. Hopefully tomorrow‚Äôs breakfast will make the journey worth it!
  • With next week being my first real travel since moving to Japan, this week was all about working through a shopping list and a todo list of preparation.
  • It snowed on Tuesday! Proper snow! In March! I don‚Äôt even own snow boots anymore!
  • Prepping a workshop for next week really didn‚Äôt take long. Finding the right brand of insect spray, surprisingly, did.
  • For lack of having the ingredients, to celebrate Pancake Day I bought some premade pancakes, some honey and some sour cream. It wasn‚Äôt until too late in the process that I realised I‚Äôd made glorified doriyaki, reader, but damn were they good.
  • Still running!
  • Is it me or is there a secret second last train which doesn‚Äôt appear on the train timetable, immediately after the last train? It‚Äôs either that or I believed a bunch of ghosts.
  • The phrase ‚Äúcost‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Deepening ‚Äî Week 09, 2025
item.description: This was the week when I tried every single commodity LLM, and a few other things we‚Äôre labelling ‚ÄúAI‚Äù. And let me tell you, oh boy have my opinions on AI flip-flopped like the integrity of a career politician. More on‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• This was the week when I tried every single commodity LLM, and a few other things we‚Äôre labelling ‚ÄúAI‚Äù. And let me tell you, oh boy have my opinions on AI flip-flopped like the integrity of a career politician. More on that after the break.

  • This week in data:

    • Papers read: 3
    • Distance run: 13.29km
    • Gigs attended: 1

  • To put it mildly, it really hasn‚Äôt been a good week from a current affairs perspective. On Thursday I started writing a message to someone and by the time I sent it on Sunday I had to redraft it, twice.

  • This has been a good week for paperwork on Planet Alex. I signed the lease for my long-term apartment this week, which was a much more involved process than any other contract signing I‚Äôve ever done, including the ones through [name of a random previous employer]‚Äôs procurement system. 10 sheets of A3 paper. My wonderful agent even had a pen and a bottle of water ready for my troubles. If anyone is looking for property in Tokyo, I will definitely connect you, please ask.

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Boxes ‚Äî Week 8, 2025
item.description: Headline this week is that I moved at the weekend. Goodbye Shibaura and hello Azabu. It‚Äôs a considerably different experience: Some streets round here don't feel like Tokyo. And amongst other things, I traded a work‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Headline this week is that I moved at the weekend. Goodbye Shibaura and hello Azabu. It‚Äôs a considerably different experience: Some streets round here don't feel like Tokyo. And amongst other things, I traded a work desk for a dining table. I haven‚Äôt had a dining table since August 2021. Now my breakfasts feel somehow dignified.

  • This week in data:

    • Papers read: 0
    • Distance run: 10.82km
    • Gigs attended: 0

  • Class is going well. We formally began the Kanji. At some point I have learned to handwrite most of the katakana and hiragana. And at Tuesday lunchtime I managed to order in a non-English-speaking restaurant without any aids, and it didn‚Äôt seem very awkward.

  • Second month in a row that I‚Äôm deep-cleaning a flat. This one was a bit easier at least: Three months is a lot less than four years.

  • MA helped me move by renting a van and helping me shift 3 bags, 2 suitcases and 1 box all in one go. This was by far the easiest inter-city move I‚Äôve ever done ‚Äî the hard part was sourcing the bags ‚Äî and I hope the next one goes just as smoothly.

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Settling ‚Äî Week 7, 2025
item.description: This was a pretty good week. I had a moment where I thought back to a question someone asked me, and I realised, that I couldn‚Äôt fault a single day this week. Considering the number of big changes that have happened in‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• This was a pretty good week. I had a moment where I thought back to a question someone asked me, and I realised, that I couldn‚Äôt fault a single day this week. Considering the number of big changes that have happened in the past 12 weeks alone, that's pretty huge. This felt good in a calm way.

  • This week in data:

    • üö∂ Distance walked: 115,895 steps
    • üßâ Jasmine tea drunk: 3 litres

  • To solve an incredibly annoying migration problem in a repeatable way, I wrote some code which parses the ES AST to extract its exports. And, it, worked? Normally I don‚Äôt do something so low-level and cursed until at least summer? So I‚Äôm pretty chuffed with that.

  • Had two stand-out work lunches, only one of which was probably unhealthy.

  • Got accepted for the apartment I applied for, which is wonderful news, but the move-in date is a little ways off. So during the week I signed another short-term lease, this one for a flat in Minami-Azabu. It‚Äôs not the most convenient for going to other parts of Tokyo, but it‚Äôs an extremely nice area I‚Äôve always enjoyed passing through, and being just on the cusp of walkable to work, I‚Äôll probably never again have the opportunity to stay there. I‚Äôm mega excited to explore a new neighbourhood. Move-in next weekend.

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Emdashing ‚Äî Week 6, 2025
item.description: Class update: Katakana are happening and they‚Äôre happening fast. I‚Äôm staying (mostly) on top of vocab, at least. Learning katakana is making grocery shopping significantly easier, mind. I finally found oatmeal, and in‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Class update: Katakana are happening and they‚Äôre happening fast. I‚Äôm staying (mostly) on top of vocab, at least.

  • Learning katakana is making grocery shopping significantly easier, mind. I finally found oatmeal, and in case the picture wasn‚Äôt enough, I know enough letters to now know that it says ‚ÄúOATMEAL‚Äù. So that‚Äôs neat. Lessons are already paying for themselves.

  • This week in data:

    • üç£ Sushi consumed: 21 pieces
    • ü•£ Oatmeal consumed: 270g

  • As part of my periodic LinkedIn doomscrolling (to reach their daily puzzle games I must open the feed) I read an incredibly bad take that using emdashes is a tell-tale sign of the use of artificial intelligence in writing, because obviously nobody uses emdashes. I remember being taught to use them in school, but, unfortunately, I do not remember how. Nonetheless I continue to use them. I hope the inaccuracies are proof enough that, at least for now, my posts are still hand-cranked.

  • Part of joining a new job is learning how the goal-setting and evaluation systems work, and I‚Äôve just about crossed that threshold this week by setting my half-yearly objectives. I‚Äôm quite happy with the approach, and the output.

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Soundproofing ‚Äî Week 5, 2025
item.description: Happy new lunar year! This week in data: üç£ Time taken to eat Ehomaki: 682.33 seconds ‚òÅÔ∏è Average humidity: 27% Had a few delightful catch-ups with people outside my team this week, so I‚Äôm feeling like I‚Äôm starting to‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Happy new lunar year!

  • This week in data:

    • üç£ Time taken to eat Ehomaki: 682.33 seconds
    • ‚òÅÔ∏è Average humidity: 27%

  • Had a few delightful catch-ups with people outside my team this week, so I‚Äôm feeling like I‚Äôm starting to settle in better ‚Äî but there‚Äôs still a lot of things for me to learn, as well as some cultural differences to navigate.

  • I don‚Äôt normally do this sort of thing, but I‚Äôve been using Endel (a soundscape app, e.g. for concentration, for activity, for sleep, etc.) - and I‚Äôm finding it incredibly good. I've used similar apps in the past - this generates music (not AI, dw), instead of playing back pre-recorded tracks, so it feels relatively fresh and non-repetitive. My default soundscape has become Richie Hawtin‚Äôs collaboration which I genuinely love. This isn‚Äôt a referral-driven recommendation, but I do have a referral code/voucher which nets you a 14-day trial (regularly 7-days).

  • The weather is currently incredibly cold and also incredibly dry which is not doing good things to my skin. To combat it, I went out and bought a humidifier and paired it with my IR hub - so now I have the ability to remotely heat and humidify my flat. It seems to be helping?

    ‚Ä¶

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Bangarang ‚Äî Week 4, 2025
item.description: This week brought the fabled health-check, of Instagram/TikTok/YouTube creator fame. I hate to shatter the illusion‚Ä† but it turns out to be a series of tests and measures to assess overall health, much like in many‚Ä¶
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• This week brought the fabled health-check, of Instagram/TikTok/YouTube creator fame. I hate to shatter the illusion‚Ä† but it turns out to be a series of tests and measures to assess overall health, much like in many other countries (other than, for some reason, the UK). To all you fellow-watchers of American sitcoms, it‚Äôs """a physical""".
  • But the REAL headline of the week is: Monday I showed up bright and early at the Shibaura-konan ward office to finally collect my MyNumber card. The whole process was pretty fast: I had to review some documents, set some passwords and then I walked out with the future of paperwork.
  • Starting to think that Next.JS belongs in the same part of my resume as Magento, IYKWIM.
  • At work we had a new-starter lunch with leadership, which gave the opportunity to submit questions ahead of time. Thinking they would be anonymised, filtered or moderated, I submitted far too many to count. I came to regret this ‚Äî because on the print-outs I saw that nearly all‚Ä¶
